source.b666a1ed:
from sklearn.preprocessing import MinMaxScaler
'''
Examples
 |  --------
 |  >>> from sklearn.preprocessing import MinMaxScaler
 |  >>> data = [[-1, 2], [-0.5, 6], [0, 10], [1, 18]]
 |  >>> scaler = MinMaxScaler()
 |  >>> print(scaler.fit(data))
 |  MinMaxScaler()
 |  >>> print(scaler.data_max_)
 |  [ 1. 18.]
 |  >>> print(scaler.transform(data))
 |  [[0.   0.  ]
 |   [0.25 0.25]
 |   [0.5  0.5 ]
 |   [1.   1.  ]]
 |  >>> print(scaler.transform([[2, 2]]))
 |  [[1.5 0. ]]
 '''
source.acb3fd93:
scaler = MinMaxScaler()
scaler.fit(data)
y = scaler.transform(data)
y
